@description.name: @description
@description.body:
*****************************************************************

qooxdoo - the new era of web development http://qooxdoo.org Copyright: 2007-2008 1&1 Internet AG, Germany, http://www.1und1.de License: MIT: https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT See the LICENSE file in the project's top-level directory for details. Authors: Sebastian Werner (wpbasti) Andreas Ecker (ecker) Fabian Jakobs (fjakobs) *

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Basic event object. Please note: Event objects are only valid during the event dispatch. After the dispatch event objects are pooled or disposed. If you want to safe a reference to an event instance use the {@link #clone} method. The interface is modeled after the DOM level 2 event interface: http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-2-Events/events.html#Events-interface

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The current event phase is the capturing phase.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The event is currently being evaluated at the target

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The current event phase is the bubbling phase.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: {qx.Promise[]} promises returned by event handlers

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Initialize the fields of the event. The event must be initialized before it can be dispatched.

@param.name: @param
@param
@param.body:
cancelable {Boolean?false} Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link #preventDefault}
@param.description:
Whether or not an event can have its default
     action prevented. The default action can either be the browser's
     default action of a native event (e.g. open the context menu on a
     right click) or the default action of a qooxdoo class (e.g. close
     the window widget). The default action can be prevented by calling
     {@link #preventDefault}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create a clone of the event object, which is not automatically disposed or pooled after an event dispatch.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: embryo {qx.event.type.Event?null} Optional event class, which will be configured using the data of this event instance. The event must be an instance of this event class. If the value is null, a new pooled instance is created.
@param.description: Optional event class, which will be configured using the data of this event instance. The event must be an instance of this event class. If the value is null, a new pooled instance is created.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Stops event from all further processing. Execute this when the current handler should have "exclusive rights" to the event and no further reaction by anyone else should happen.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This method is used to prevent further propagation of an event during event flow. If this method is called by any event listener the event will cease propagating through the tree. The event will complete dispatch to all listeners on the current event target before event flow stops.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get whether further event propagation has been stopped.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether further propagation has been stopped.
@return.description: Whether further propagation has been stopped.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Prevent the default action of cancelable events, e.g. opening the context menu, …

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a promise to the list of promises returned by event handlers

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the array of promises, or null if there are no promises

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a promise for this event; if the event is defaultPrevented, the promise is a rejected promise, otherwise it is fulfilled. The promise returned will only be fulfilled when the promises added via {@link addPromise} are also fulfilled

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get whether the default action has been prevented

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the default action has been prevented
@return.description: Whether the default action has been prevented

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The name of the event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Override the event type

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Used to indicate which phase of event flow is currently being evaluated.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Integer} The current event phase. Possible values are
         {@link #CAPTURING_PHASE}, {@link #AT_TARGET} and {@link #BUBBLING_PHASE}.
@return.description:
The current event phase. Possible values are
         {@link #CAPTURING_PHASE}, {@link #AT_TARGET} and {@link #BUBBLING_PHASE}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Override the event phase

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The time (in milliseconds relative to the epoch) at which the event was created.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the timestamp the event was created.
@return.description: the timestamp the event was created.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the event target to which the event was originally dispatched.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Element} target to which the event was originally
       dispatched.
@return.description:
target to which the event was originally
       dispatched.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Override event target.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the event target node whose event listeners are currently being processed. This is particularly useful during event capturing and bubbling.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Element} The target the event listener is currently
       dispatched on.
@return.description:
The target the event listener is currently
       dispatched on.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Override current target.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the related event target. This is only configured for events which also had an influences on another element e.g. mouseover/mouseout, focus/blur, …

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Override related target.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the original event target. This is only configured for events which are fired by another event (often when the target should be reconfigured for another view) e.g. low-level DOM event to widget event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Override original target.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Check whether or not the event is a bubbling event. If the event can bubble the value is true, else the value is false.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set whether the event bubbles.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get whether the event is cancelable

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set whether the event is cancelable

@param.name: @param
@param.body: cancelable {Boolean} Whether the event is cancelable

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxObjectId. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.
